bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 14, 1952

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that he and Love have both received invitations to the Camp Lazear dedication, but regrets that he will be unable to attend.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 14, 1952
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 14, 1952
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Just a note to advise you that I am just in receipt of a letter
inviting me to be present at the ceremonies attending the dedication
of Camp Lazear. I have just replied to this letter explaining my
very great regret that it will not be possible for me to attend.
I know that General Love has also received an invitation.

In my lette acknowledging receipt of the invitation, I have
asked that they send us a copy of the proceedings of the dedication
ceremonies, should they be published, in order that we may have them
for filing with the records of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

I am delighted that it will be possible for you to go down for
the ceremonies and hope that you will have a pleasant visit.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Walter Reed Memorial
Association
